title: Rome IV Diagnostic Criteria for Infant Dyschezia
desc: The Rome IV criteria for infant dyschezia provides criteria for the diagnosis of infant dyschezia.

orgreference.text: Benninga MA, Faure C, Hyman PE, St james roberts I, Schechter NL, Nurko S. Childhood Functional Gastrointestinal Disorders: Neonate/Toddler. Gastroenterology. 2016; 1443-1455.

data.evidence:
To fulfill the Rome IV criteria for infant dyschezia, patient must be <9 months of age and have the following:

  1. ≥10 minutes of straining and crying before successful or unsuccessful passage of soft stools.
  2. No other health problems.
